content:
There is a mailto: protocol that is used and windows has to have it set all special like. The default mail client is not good enough. There are however also settings in the browser that need to be set up for links on web sites. The mailto setup for windows is only for mailto links from desktop apps.

A google search turned up these instructions which appear fairly comprehensive. https://www.makeuseof.com/tag/how-to-change-the-default-email-program-for-mailto-links
creator: MattAuSupport

content: This 'sounds like' your earlier setup was using POP on the desktop, as the option to 'leave on server' is explicit for POP accounts, but not IMAP accounts. With IMAP, once deleted it's gone. Your phone is probably IMAP,which works fine if POP is leaving messages on server. My suggestion (assuming I understand your situation), is to reinstall as POP on desktop.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi David, Thank you. Is it possible to switch to POP without leaving all the mails? Is there a tutorial?

Thanks.
creator: michael.martin1966

content: If your account is set as IMAP, you can create a POP account alongside it. If you keep both, it is important to remember that they are the same account. That is, if you delete message from one, it is deleted on the other. I'm unclear on your question. If you want to leave messages on server, I suggest NOT inserting password when setting up account, as you can then review and adjust settings prior to downloading messages. At account settings>server settings you can set as desired.
creator: davidsk

content:
Se conosci un programma che usato per 10 anni non abbia mai dato problemi o perso qualche dato, beh presentamelo che sarebbe un caso di studio interessante... Ciò che voglio dire è che vale per Thunderbird quanto vale per qualsiasi altro programma: bisogna fare i backup. E non c'è alternativa che regga a questa regola.

Detto questo, se la posta è IMAP e se sul server del fornitore è ancora tutto presente, ti basta creare un nuovo profilo e scaricare nuovamente tutto -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/utilizzare-piu-profili

Se tutto funziona, continua ad usare esclusivamente il nuovo profilo. Eventualmente quando sarai certo che non manchi nulla, puoi anche cancellare il precedente profilo.

Chiedevi dov'è finita la posta. La risposta è semplice: Con IMAP la tua posta sta sul server del fornitore e Thunderbird si limita a mostrarla quando apri un messaggio. Per avere una copia fisica sul tuo computer devi manualmente crearne una copia all'interno di Cartelle locali di Thunderbird. -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/differenze-imap-pop3
creator: @next

content:
re : emails with subject "Bid S011090833"

Should this be threaded under a top level email with subject "Bid S011090833" or should it be it's own top level thread ?

This can occur if you had replied to an email with a different subject and then you changed the Subject or if the person sending to you had changed the subject in their reply.

Have you tried this:

  • change folder to 'unthreaded' so all is a list.
  • Then right click on folder and select 'Properties'
  • click on 'Repair Folder'
  • click on 'OK'
  • Then reselect 'Threaded'
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Repairing the folder did the trick. Thanks.

content:
Did you close the 'Address Book' after altering name to ensure all data was updated correctly?

Also check to see if you have more than one entry for that contact in the 'Address Book' In 'Address Book' select 'All Address Books' Sort by 'email addresses' so they get listed in alphabetical order. Enable the 'Address Book' column header.

Now look for the 'email address' of that person. If there is more than one entry using that email address they should listed one above the other and the 'Address Book' column will tell you which address book has that contact. One of them you edited the name - perhaps there is another entry.

content: Please follow Wayne's suggestion. If you post whatever problems you are having, I think we can assist. Like you, I was annoyed initially with 115 because it was different, but after I adjusted a few settings, I would not want to revert to 102. Actually, my 115 now looks almost identical to 102, but better. What I do suggest is that you go to settings>privacy&security and set Thunderbird to NOT automatically update, which is why you were updated from 102 to 115. That puts you back in control for future versions. The benefit of 115 is that it is actively supported and 102 is at end-of-life.

content:
I'm trying to understand this issue.

It sounds like you click on email to read contents, but you get a load of emails opening each in a new tab. Is that correct ?

If yes, this means you have 'Sort by' > 'Threaded' enabled.

If you have a collapsed thread and you click on the top level thread then this means open all threads and it's not new. This action has been in Thunderbird for a very long time.

You have two options: 1. Expand the thread by clicking on the chevron icon shown to the left of the Email so you see all subthreads then click on the relevant email. 2. Switch off threading - View > Sort by > select 'Unthreaded'
creator: Toad-Hall

content: For general guidelines on adding an image to signature, see this URL: http://kb.mozillazine.org/Signatures_-_Thunderbird#Removing_the_signature_separator I also suggest you reconsider use of vector image, as that is not yet universal, as are jpg and png files.

content:
Is the folder in the 'Deleted' or 'TRash' folder ? If yes, then you can drag it out of the 'Trash' and drop it onto the actual account name folder to put back as a top level folder or drop into another folder as a sub folder.

Is this an imap account or a pop account ? If imap, please logon to webmail account via a browser and check to see if folder is still on server. If not on server then you deleted it.

You would need to use a backup to import the mbox file back into 'Local Folders' mail account. Then create anew fodler in Imap account and finally copy emails from 'Local Folders' back into the imap folder - thus uploading back onto server.

content:
There shouldn't be any need to delete the Default account, but you should check that each account is sending on the correct smtp, with a matching User Name. Select an account in the left pane of Account Settings, then look at Outgoing Server (SMTP) in the right pane. Click Edit SMTP server... to see the smtp User Name.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1350593
